author: ercmagic
content: Can contributing to ZKSync be part of the apprenticeship program?

author: jinfwhuang
content: No, I don't have anything specific in mind.

author: ja_0001
content: Hi man. What is the most effective way to contribute for or during the merge process ? Understanding a consensus client ? Or going into the rabbit hole for sharding and/or roll ups ? Beacon ? Sorry if what I just said is not applicable to my question, but  the most important point is to read you (and anybody else please feel free). Thanks !

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes

author: pipermerriam
content: This type of generic "shotgun" offer to help with no specificicity typically won't get you anywhere. Do your due diligence. Read up on what's been written. Join public calls. Gain some understanding and keep your eyes open for things that look like you could help with

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Testing re merge. We're currently working on creating static test cases, mock implementations, fuzzing, etc. If you're interested in that you can dm me. Am on holiday until monday though

author: pipermerriam
content: Emails have just been sent to all cohort-one applicants with the results of the selection process.  If you don't have something in your inbox (or spam folder) within the next hour or so reach out to me directly so we can figure out what went wrong.

author: trent_vanepps
content:
worth reminding that anyone is welcome to still participate, create a project without being "accepted"

we'll be here giving feedback / suggestions on whoever is here regardless!

author: pipermerriam
content: Anyone who is interested in diving into ZK related things should DM me with their telegram handle.  I have a group chat I can add you to that has some of the ZK researchers in it.  Don't expect them to teach you things, but they can definitely answer questions if you take the time to do your homework and ask them a good question.
